definition: abbr. for 青海[Qing1 hai3], Qinghai Province
muscle/tendon/veins visible under the skin/sth resembling tendons or veins (e.g. fiber in a vegetable)

sentences.english: He shouted at his brother, his neck veins bulging.
sentences.chinese: 他朝他的兄弟吼叫，脖子上青筋暴突。

sentences.english: Describe the veins on the back of her hands.
Climbs Hou on the Bin face to sweat profusely , the double arm blue vein storm leaves.
sentences.chinese: 攀缘中的侯斌脸上大汗淋漓，双臂青筋暴出。

sentences.english: Rubs his thick veined hands. Prays.
Chafing and choking with rage; like cords were the veins on his temples.
sentences.chinese: 因愤怒而烦躁以至哽噎，额头上青筋暴出如同绳索。

sentences.english: The veins on his forehead seem ready to pop.
sentences.chinese: 他前额上的青筋突突直跳。

sentences.english: Mentions this matter, in Zhang the volume the blue vein braves straight.
sentences.chinese: 说起这事，张某额上青筋直冒。

sentences.english: Jaw muscles and clenched, and temple or neck veins throb.
sentences.chinese: 下巴肌肉紧绷着，太阳穴或脖子上青筋突出。

sentences.english: Blue veins stood out on his temples.
He was so infuriated that the blue veins on his forehead protruded out.
sentences.chinese: 他十分愤怒，额头上的青筋都凸出了。

sentences.english: The veins stand out on the back of her hands.
He had thick veins in his forehead, a little nose, and a large chin.
sentences.chinese: 他脑门子上青筋很粗，鼻子很小，下巴可又很大。

definition: to turn red (in the face)/to flush (with embarrassment or anger)
very red/red through and through/to blush (deep red)
wisps of blood/visible veins/(of eyes) bloodshot
to twitch/to throb/a spasm/to extract and use
